intro: Tragium apulum, commonly known as the yellow centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Tragium apulum has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and along roadsides.
